item.title: Bulletin updated at 12:02 HKT 17/09/2020
item.description:
At noon at the Hong Kong Observatory :
Air temperature : 31 degrees Celsius
Relative Humidity : 78 per cent
During the past hour the mean UV Index recorded at King's Park : 9
Intensity of UV radiation : very high

Tropical Cyclone Noul adopted a more westerly track this morning and maintained some distance from Hong Kong. According to the present forecast track, Noul will skirt around 800 kilometres southwest of Hong Kong later today. Its direct threat to Hong Kong is not high. The chance to issue tropical cyclone warning signal is relatively low. With the northeast monsoon affecting the south China coast gradually, there will be occasional strong winds over offshore waters and on high ground in Hong Kong today and tomorrow. Showers will also increase gradually with squally thunderstorms. There will be swells. Members of the public should beware of the weather change.

Please be reminded that:
The Thunderstorm Warning has been issued. It will remain effective until 2:00 p.m. today. A few squally thunderstorms are expected to occur over Hong Kong.
